description: This course focuses on the creative use of digital video. Students study all aspects of video
production from concept to screening, including idea generation, pre-production planning,
storyboarding, lighting, shooting, editing, and sound design. Additionally, students regularly
screen, analyze, and discuss contemporary and historic video art and avant-garde films.
Students produce short video projects with special emphasis on conceptual thinking and
experimentation. Prerequisites: Art 104 or permission of instructor. Materials fee. Offered
alternate years. Counts toward film studies and media studies concentrations.
